word: There are many, like grown-up children, who seem to live merely to eat and drink and to gratify their own desires. . . . Their minds become degraded by vice and amusement, and the ceaseless round of gratification of the lowest indulgences.--Letter 131, 1904, pp. 3-5,6. (To Brethren Sharp and Caro, April 11, 1904.)
